attributes.action: Honour mortgage in principles if they run out in quarantine/pandemic
attributes.additional_details: because it always sounds better coming from the government then coming from someone who walked into a building society or bank and the government is able to help more having this in place will help the housing market during the pandemic as well as the uncertainty of having to find other buyers or other housing.
attributes.background: For those who are in the process of purchasing properties and have a mortgage in principle should be protected too and any mortgage in principle should be honoured due to the pandemic if the time is exceeded.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for the issue you raise. Decisions about mortgage agreements are for individual lenders, not the Government or Parliament. 

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

### What the Petitions Committee is doing

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak. 
 
Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
